span.br: Home of the New Braunfels Unicorns!

div.class: outercontainer floatleft clearfix primarycolor no-border no-margin

img.alt: We Miss Your Kids - We Miss Our Kids

div.p: The health and safety of our students, staff and visitors is paramount, and we are closely monitoring the spread of COVID-19. We are adhering to guidance from the local health officials, the Texas Department of Health & Human Services and the Center of Disease Control (CDC). With information changing daily, we encourage families to stay up to date on information about COVID-19. Below you will find helpful resources and update information:
The first positive case of COVID-19 was confirmed in Comal County on March 18, 2020. Related Link
The first death related to COVID-19 of a Comal County resident occurred on March 26, 2020. Related Link
The first suspected case of community spread in Comal County was announced on March 27, 2020. Related Link
For more information, go to the Comal County Public Health Department Website.
Remote learning and instruction will continue for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. The last day of school will be May 28, 2020.
All facilities including indoor/outdoor athletic courts, fields and tracks are also closed.

p.span: All extracurricular activities, field trips, practices, student events and athletic events are also suspended during this time.

img.alt: Remote Learning & Instruction will continue until the end of the 2019-2020 school year.
img.title: Remote Learning & Instruction will continue until the end of the 2019-2020 school year.
img.longdesc: Remote Learning & Instruction will continue until the end of the 2019-2020 school year.

p.span: To best expedite any potential help you may need with your child's iPad or any of their apps, we have created a parent Help Desk phone number and online ticket system for you. Please use either one of the avenues to request help for the management of the iPad or workflow of your child's assignments.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: Please note: Due to our work from home guidelines, if you call and get voicemail PLEASE leave a message, we will get back with you quickly.

strong.em: Emailed to Parents & Posted on March 20, 2020

div.p: If you do not have any connectivity at home, we have created a “SchoolWifi” network at every one of our campuses that will connect to any device, including your personal devices, no password needed. This will obviously require you to drive to the school and connect, but you should be able to sit in your car in the drive through and get connected.

Also, below is the information I have collected concerning connectivity at home. You will obviously need to call your provider to verify the information below applies to your plan, but this is the information they have communicated to me regarding any special offers.
AT&T - Offers open hot-spots, unlimited data to existing customers, and $10/month plans to low income families.
Comcast - Offers free WiFi for 2 months to low income families plus all Xfinity hot-spots are free to the public during this time.
Sprint - Providing unlimited data to existing customers will allow all phones to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge.
T-Mobile - Unlimited data to existing customers and will allow all phones to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge.
Charter/Spectrum - Free Internet offer for 2 months. Call 1-844-488-8395 for more information.
Verizon - No special offers at this time.

div.p: View Larger English | View Larger Spanish

img.alt: APART WE STAND TOGETHER IT TAKES ALL OF US TO SAVE LIVES!
img.title: APART WE STAND TOGETHER IT TAKES ALL OF US TO SAVE LIVES!
img.longdesc: APART WE STAND TOGETHER IT TAKES ALL OF US TO SAVE LIVES! The New Braunfels ISD community must work together to fight COVID-19. Head to http://tea.texas.gov/staywell for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.

div.p: View Larger English | View Larger Spanish
Currently there are no vaccines to prevent the Coronavirus infections.
Please remind your student of the importance of following good hygiene practices that prevent the spread of communicable disease.
General preventative measures to protect yourself from respiratory illness including the Coronavirus disease, are :

ul.li: Cover your coughs and sneezes with a sleeve or a tissue.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for 20 seconds, or use alcohol hand sanitizer if soap and water are not available.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth.
Stay at home when you are sick.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

div.div: We will try our best to post all of the canceled, rescheduled or postponed events being affected by the closure of New Braunfels ISD online under our "Weather & Event Updates" page. All postings have a date stamp and will be timestamped. If you have a questions about an upcoming event, please email news@nbisd.org.

p.a: CDC - Coronavirus Disease 2019 Information for Travel

div.p: Currently NBISD does not have any school-sponsored trips planned internationally.
Currently NBISD does not have any students traveling domestically and has halted all employee travel.

p.em: If COVID-19 has left you feeling mentally, emotionally, spiritually or financially hopeless you are not alone. Your community is here to help. Visit comalcountycares.com or call:

div.p:
Comal County Multi-Agency Resource Center
830-606-9512

Mobile Crisis Outreach Team (if you are in CRISIS)
877-466-0660
24-Hour Crisis Hotline 1-800-532-8192
Guide - https://bit.ly/2XxwKGp
